materials.raw_text: B: 60 g, Co: 160 g, Ni: 20 g, Sc: 10 g, Zr: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Boron powder from chemical suppliers; Co: Cobalt powder from metal suppliers; Ni: Nickel powder from metal suppliers; Sc: Scandium oxide from specialty chemical suppliers; Zr: Zirconium powder from metal suppliers.

1. Measure 60 g of boron powder, 160 g of cobalt powder, 20 g of nickel powder, 10 g of scandium oxide, and 40 g of zirconium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all measured powders uniformly using a spatula or mechanical mixer. 3. Ensure homogeneity of the blend by mixing for at least 10 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 60 g of boron powder, 160 g of cobalt powder, 20 g of nickel powder, 10 g of scandium oxide, and 40 g of zirconium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all measured powders uniformly using a spatula or mechanical mixer. 3. Ensure homogeneity of the blend by mixing for at least 10 minutes.

steps: 1. Transfer the blended powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200 째C (2192 째F). 3. Once temperature is reached, place the crucible inside for 2 hours to ensure complete sintering of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the blended powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200 째C (2192 째F). 3. Once temperature is reached, place the crucible inside for 2 hours to ensure complete sintering of the materials.

steps: 1. After the sintering process, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature for approximately 4 hours. 2. Ensure the crucible is not disturbed during the cooling process to avoid cracks in the solid sample.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the sintering process, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature for approximately 4 hours. 2. Ensure the crucible is not disturbed during the cooling process to avoid cracks in the solid sample.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible gently using appropriate tools. 2. Inspect the surface for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. If necessary, use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surface. 4. Optionally, apply a sealing agent suitable for the materials to enhance durability.
